---
title: "My Name Is Sara"
author: "Sara Saju"
---



## Introduction

*I am writing this for Arvind's class. Its kind of interesting.*

## My First Piece of R Code



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1

✔ purrr     1.0.2
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggformula)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Loading required package: scales

Attaching package: 'scales'

The following object is masked from 'package:purrr':
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(babynames)
```
:::



## Using the babynames library to get a list of data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1,924,665 × 5
    year sex   name          n   prop
   <dbl> <chr> <chr>     <int>  <dbl>
 1  1880 F     Mary       7065 0.0724
 2  1880 F     Anna       2604 0.0267
 3  1880 F     Emma       2003 0.0205
 4  1880 F     Elizabeth  1939 0.0199
 5  1880 F     Minnie     1746 0.0179
 6  1880 F     Margaret   1578 0.0162
 7  1880 F     Ida        1472 0.0151
 8  1880 F     Alice      1414 0.0145
 9  1880 F     Bertha     1320 0.0135
10  1880 F     Sarah      1288 0.0132
# ℹ 1,924,655 more rows
```


:::
:::



## Filtering the data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames %>% filter (name == "Sara")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 222 × 5
    year sex   name      n    prop
   <dbl> <chr> <chr> <int>   <dbl>
 1  1880 F     Sara    165 0.00169
 2  1881 F     Sara    147 0.00149
 3  1882 F     Sara    180 0.00156
 4  1883 F     Sara    183 0.00152
 5  1884 F     Sara    197 0.00143
 6  1885 F     Sara    215 0.00151
 7  1886 F     Sara    247 0.00161
 8  1887 F     Sara    214 0.00138
 9  1888 F     Sara    293 0.00155
10  1889 F     Sara    286 0.00151
# ℹ 212 more rows
```


:::
:::



## Creating a graph



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames %>% filter(name == "Sara") %>% 
  gf_line(n~year)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



*Sara was a more popular name than I thought it was.*

## Filtering data and plotting names with different spellings



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames %>% filter(name == "Sara"| name == "Sarah") %>% gf_line(n~year)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Filtering the data (part 2)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames %>% filter(name == "Maya"| name == "Maaya")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 98 × 5
    year sex   name      n       prop
   <dbl> <chr> <chr> <int>      <dbl>
 1  1940 F     Maya      5 0.00000423
 2  1942 F     Maya      5 0.0000036 
 3  1943 F     Maya      5 0.00000348
 4  1949 F     Maya     10 0.0000057 
 5  1950 F     Maya      7 0.00000398
 6  1951 F     Maya      8 0.00000433
 7  1952 F     Maya      7 0.00000368
 8  1953 F     Maya     15 0.00000778
 9  1954 F     Maya      9 0.00000452
10  1955 F     Maya      9 0.00000449
# ℹ 88 more rows
```


:::
:::



```         
```

## Graph of the received data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames %>% filter(name == "Maya"| name == "Maaya") %>% gf_line (n~year)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
